messages.message: @dlluncor it looks like some of these already had “USE_PY3=true” set, and they were at least pretending to pass. We added the python3 dependencies on the jenkins container, and it doesn’t seem to behave any differently. Should some of these fail?
If it's mypy, then technically those did not require Python 3 libs...it's a bit confusing I know
make build mypy USE_PY3=true doesn't require executing the actual code, since mypy is a parser
However make build run-test-local USE_PY3=true actually executes the code, and requires all the necessary modules to be installed for py3
Where would we run `make build run-test-local USE_PY3=true`?
Oh service by service, not one big test suite?
yeah all the tests are in each service or package.

That's how we currently do it. If we want to separate those tests into groups somehow -- totally up for it. Let us know what are mechanisms for packaging various tests using Jenkins or Travis. Will lean on you all for that knowledge!
I think this is running the desired test… it looks like it is failing because of a type failure, not because of something else I got wrong? https://jenkins.instabase.com/job/py3/

This is not the easiest test to use out the gate — because it doesn’t pass correctly for PY3 yet.

Let’s start with instabase/core-services/file-tservice

Since those tests actually pass in PY3
Ok I think I have a couple of dep related failures to work around
